definition: reflector (typically concave, as in a torch)/mirror (typically plane or convex)
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: How much is a pair of anti-reflection lenses?
sentences.chinese: 一對不反光鏡片大約要多少錢？

sentences.english: Light sources is gathered by double-direction reflectors that can improve light utilization effectively.
sentences.chinese: 可採用雙向反光鏡降光，有效提高燈光照射度。

sentences.english: Winch upgrade, load and a set of dual-reflector system link.
sentences.chinese: 有提升絞盤，負載反光鏡和一套雙掛鉤系統。

sentences.english: Recently, a new generation of mirrorless cameras have hit the market.
sentences.chinese: 不過最近，新一代的無反光鏡相機已投放市場。

sentences.english: But the reflectors do of course have to be emplaced and removed.
sentences.chinese: 當然，還需要有人安置和拆卸反光鏡。

sentences.english: The rear view mirror sleeves are made of ultra transparent membrane.
sentences.chinese: 反光鏡套可由超透明膜做成。

sentences.english: The camera he's using now is a twin- lens reflex one.
sentences.chinese: 他正在使用的是雙鏡頭反光鏡相機。

sentences.english: Exposed The polishing of chromium layer has high reflection coefficient, can make reflector.
sentences.chinese: 經拋光的鉻層有很高的反射係數，可作反光鏡。

definition: the front (nose) of a plane etc
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
